alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 3:28PM EDT until March 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
